t: Isaiah 45
Cyrus, God’s Instrument

Thus*pn says the Lord*s to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose*ld right hand I have grasped, to*ln subdue nations before him and*ld to loose the belts of kings, to*ln open doors before him that*ld gates may not be closed:
“I*ln will go before you and*ld level the exalted places, I*ln will break in pieces the doors of bronze and*ld cut through the bars of iron,
I*ln will give you the treasures of darkness and*ld the hoards in secret places, that*ln you may know that it is I, the Lord,*s the*ld God of Israel, who call you by your name.
For*ln the sake of my servant Jacob, and*ld Israel my chosen, I*ln call you by your name, I*ld name you, though you do not know me.
I*ln am the Lord,*s and there is no other, besides*ld me there is no God; I*ld equip you, though you do not know me,
that*ln people may know, from the rising of the sun and*ld from the west, that there is none besides me; I*ld am the Lord,*s and there is no other.
I*ln form light and create darkness; I*ld make well-being and create calamity; I*ld am the Lord,*s who does all these things.

“Shower,*pn O heavens, from above, and*ld let the clouds rain down righteousness; let*ln the earth open, that salvation and righteousness may bear fruit; let*ld the earth cause them both to sprout; I*ld the Lord*s have created it.
“Woe*pn to him who strives with him who formed him, a*ld pot among earthen pots! Does*ln the clay say to him who forms it, ‘What are you making?’ or*ld ‘Your work has no handles’?
Woe*ln to him who says to a father, ‘What are you begetting?’ or*ld to a woman, ‘With what are you in labor?’”
Thus*pn says the Lord,*s the*ld Holy One of Israel, and the one who formed him: “Ask*ln me of things to come; will*ld you command me concerning my children and the work of my hands?
I*ln made the earth and*ld created man on it; it*ln was my hands that stretched out the heavens, and*ld I commanded all their host.
I*ln have stirred him up in righteousness, and*ld I will make all his ways level; he*ln shall build my city and*ld set my exiles free, not*ln for price or reward,” says*ld the Lord*s of hosts.
The Lord, the Only Savior

Thus*pn says the Lord:*s “The*ln wealth of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush, and*ld the Sabeans, men of stature, shall*ln come over to you and be yours; they*ld shall follow you; they*ld shall come over in chains and bow down to you. They*ln will plead with you, saying: ‘Surely*ld God is in you, and there is no other, no*ld god besides him.’”
Truly,*pn you are a God who hides himself, O*ld God of Israel, the Savior.
All*ln of them are put to shame and confounded; the*ld makers of idols go in confusion together.
But*ln Israel is saved by the Lord*s with*ld everlasting salvation; you*ln shall not be put to shame or confounded to*ld all eternity.

For*pn thus says the Lord,*s who*ln created the heavens (he*ld is God!), who*ln formed the earth and made it (he*ld established it; he*ln did not create it empty, he*ld formed it to be inhabited!): “I*ln am the Lord,*s and there is no other.
I*ln did not speak in secret, in*ld a land of darkness; I*ln did not say to the offspring of Jacob, ‘Seek*ld me in vain.’ I*ln the Lord*s speak the truth; I*ld declare what is right.

“Assemble*pn yourselves and come; draw*ld near together, you*ld survivors of the nations! They*ln have no knowledge who*ld carry about their wooden idols, and*ln keep on praying to a god that*ld cannot save.

Declare*ln and present your case; let*ld them take counsel together! Who*ln told this long ago? Who*ld declared it of old? Was*ln it not I, the Lord?*s And*ld there is no other god besides me, a*ln righteous God and a Savior; there*ld is none besides me.
“Turn*pn to me and be saved, all*ld the ends of the earth! For*ld I am God, and there is no other.
By*ln myself I have sworn; from*ld my mouth has gone out in righteousness a*ld word that shall not return: ‘To*ln me every knee shall bow, every*ld tongue shall swear allegiance.’
“Only*pn in the Lord,*s it shall be said of me, are*ld righteousness and strength; to*ln him shall come and be ashamed all*ld who were incensed against him.
In*ln the Lord*s all the offspring of Israel shall*ld be justified and shall glory.”
